com.percussion.services.assembly
Interface IPSAssemblyItem

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
IPSAssemblyResult
public interface IPSAssemblyItem
extends Cloneable, Serializable

Each unit of work to be assembled is represented by an assembly item. The item encapsulates all the information necessary. The output of the assembly process is IPSAssemblyResult, which may or may not be represented by the same underlying object. Note that if multipage rendering is implemented, there could be multiple output results for a single item.

If the item is created using IPSAssemblyService.createAssemblyItem() then you must explicitely call normalize() before assembly. Once the item has been normalized, either though the explicit call or the implicit call made by the deprecated creation call, the setters should not be called.

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

getPath

String getPath()
The path is of the form //folder1/folder2/.../foldern/itemname and may end in an option #revnumber. If a revision is not specified, then the current revision of the item is used. A path that only contains numbers is taken as a direct reference to a particular content id, and may also be modified by a revision number. Child items can be referenced below the item as .../folder/itemname/childname#nnn where nnn is the index of the particular child item. With revision it becomes .../itemname#revision/childname#nnn

Items that are not in a folder may be referenced by a synthentic path that starts with "/" instead of "//". The syntax is /cid#revision. For example /301#1 will reference the first revision an item with content id 301.

The path may either have been passed in, or may be calculated from parameter values. When calculated from the parameter values, the parameter sys_folderid must be present to get a complete path. If the parameter is missing, then the simplified "/nnn#rr" will be returned instead.

Returns:
the path, never null or empty

getNode

Node getNode()
The content node being assembled. If the node is null (normal case) then the assembly engine will load the node from the content manager using the path. If the node is already loaded, as may be the case for certain slot finders, the node will be used.

If this is called and the node is not set or loaded by the assembly manager, the method will force the load, which will take care of code that wishes to use the node after the item has been assembled by the legacy plugin.

Returns:
the node, may be null if not yet loaded

hasNode

boolean hasNode()
If the node is loaded or set, then this method will return true otherwise false. This method will not cause the node to be loaded.

Returns:
true if the node is loaded for the assembly item.

setNode

void setNode(Node node)
This method allows the caller to change or set the node being referenced by the assembly item. This is normally called internally to the assembly service in order to set the node being processed, but can also be called in conjunction with calling Object.clone().

The valid use case for this is generally in slot processing, where the slot content finder returns references to the slot contents. The source assembly item is cloned and then the new node (and other new information) is placed in the cloned assembly items.

Parameters:
node - the node, may be null to reset the node. Also modifies the id stored. The id will be set to null for a null node

getFilter

IPSItemFilter getFilter()
                        throws PSFilterException
Get the item filter, which can be used to limit the results from various slot finder and elsewhere. The item filter will be derived from the authtype or filter parameters, as available.

Returns:
Returns the filter, if null then no filtering will occur.
Throws:
PSFilterException - if there was a filter specified in the parameters, but it was not found

getParameters

Map<String,String[]> getParameters()
Parameters apply to the template and item to be assembled. The data in the parameters is dependent on the template and assembler plugin that is used. Coming from the assembly servlet, this map will also contain all passed HTML parameters. Repeated parameters will have multiple values in the string array.

Returns:
a map of parameters, may be empty, but never null

getParameterValue

String getParameterValue(String name,
                         String defaultvalue)
Get single parameter value.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter, never null or empty
defaultvalue - the default value to return if the parameter is not defined, may be null or empty
Returns:
the value or default value for the given parameter name

getParameterValues

String[] getParameterValues(String name,
                            String[] defaultvalues)
Get parameter values.

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter, never null or empty
defaultvalues - the default values to return if the parameter is not defined, may be null or empty
Returns:
the values or default values for the given parameter name

hasParameter

boolean hasParameter(String name)
The parameter is present in the set of parameters. It may or may not have a value. Use this method to distinguish if a parameter is present but empty, versus not present

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter, never null or empty
Returns:
true if the parameter is present, regardless of the associated value

getVariables

Map<String,String> getVariables()
Additional variables to bind when handling the template, may be null or empty. Note that the contents of this entering the assembly service will be the context variables that have been defined.

Any additional variables that are bound as part of the assembly process will not be present in this map. See the bindings instead.

Returns:
a map of variables, may be null

getBindings

Map<String,Object> getBindings()
Any bindings calculated by the assembly service can be retrieved via this method. If no bindings are calculated, this will return null.

Returns:
empty if there are no bindings, otherwise a set of named values. Each value may contain an object, a sub map or a list of values.

getTemplate

IPSAssemblyTemplate getTemplate()
The template to use in the assembly. Set by the assembly engine before the bindings process begins. Never set for legacy templates.

Returns:
the template, may be null

getOriginalTemplateGuid

IPSGuid getOriginalTemplateGuid()
As an item is assembled, the value returned by getTemplate() may change. For example, after the inner content is assembled, the template is changed to the global template before processing. Dispatch templates also exhibit this behavior.

Some users may need to know what the original template was. This method returns that id. This value is cleared when the item is cloned.

Returns:
The id of the template first set on this work item, or the current template if this value is currently null. May be null if a template is not set.

getReferenceId

long getReferenceId()
The reference id identifies a particular assembly request within a given job. The reference id allows a caller to associate assembly results and requests. While reference ids could be reused across preview requests, they will never be repeated for publishing jobs.

Returns:
the id, may be any value, but unique for a given job id

getUnpublishRefId

Long getUnpublishRefId()
Get the reference ID that the unpublishing was originated from.

Returns:
the reference ID. It may be null if isPublish() returns true.

getJobId

long getJobId()
The job id is unique per publishing run and helps a caller associate results and requests for a given run. This id is also used internally to determine if certain cached values can be reused, therefore this value should be changed for each new assembly job, which includes new previews.

Returns:
the job id, may be any value, but different for each run

getId

IPSGuid getId()
Get the guid for the item specified.

Returns:
the guid from the item specified by the path or parameters. Will never return null for a valid assembly item. Calling this method will derive the id from either the sys_contentid and sys_revision parameters or the path.

getSiteId

IPSGuid getSiteId()
Get the site id if defined for the assembly item. The site id is extracted from the site id http parameter. Note that if the item is created for a slot, then the site id may be the site id of the referenced site rather than the original site.

Returns:
the site id, or null if the parameter is missing

getFolderId

int getFolderId()
Get the folder content id if defined for the assembly item. The folder id may be extracted from the folder http parameter or from the path.

Returns:
the folder content id, or 0 if the folder is not defined

isDebug

boolean isDebug()
Indicates if the item should be assembled in debug mode. Debug mode outputs information about the assembly, but doesn't run the plug in. This is inherited by cloned items.

Returns:
true for an item to be debugged.

isPublish

boolean isPublish()
Indicates if this assembly is for a publishing or unpublishing case. This will return true for publishing or previews. The value false can be used by the assembly plugin to short circuit processing when appropriate.

Returns:
false for unpublishing

getUserName

String getUserName()
Get the user name set. The user name informs preview and active assembly who the user is, which allows assembly to display the appropriate versions of items in preview.

Returns:
the user name, may be null but never empty.

getCloneParentItem

IPSAssemblyItem getCloneParentItem()
As a specific item is assembled, the implementation often will clone the item in order to handle some contained item such as slot content. When this happens, this method allows the implementation to find out what the parent assembly item is. This is set as part of the clone() method.

Returns:
either null for an item that was constructed, or the parent assembly item for an assembly item that was cloned.

getPage

Integer getPage()
If this is for a paged item's page, then this will return the page number. Page numbers are 1 based. If the item contains a page number, it will also contain a parent reference id.

Returns:
the page number or null if there is no page number.

setPage

void setPage(Integer page)
Set the page number

Parameters:
page - the page number, may be null

getParentPageReferenceId

Long getParentPageReferenceId()
If this is for a paged item's page, then this will return the original paginated page's reference id so that status update can mark the parent as failed if the child page fails. This is also used so the assembly system knows whether the page should be evaluated for pagination.

Returns:
the parent reference id or null if this is not a page child item.

setParentPageReferenceId

void setParentPageReferenceId(long refid)
Set the parent reference id

Parameters:
refid - the parent reference id, may be null.

setFolderId

void setFolderId(int folderId)
Set a new folder id, see getFolderId()

Parameters:
folderId - the new folder id

setSiteId

void setSiteId(IPSGuid siteid)
Set a new site id, see getSiteId()

Parameters:
siteid - the new site id

setBindings

void setBindings(Map<String,Object> bindings)
Set new bindings, see getBindings()

Parameters:
bindings - The bindings to set, may be null

setId

void setId(IPSGuid id)
Set a new id for the referenced content item, see getId()

Parameters:
id - The id to set, may be null

setParameters

void setParameters(Map<String,String[]> parameters)
Set the new parameters, see getParameters()

Parameters:
parameters - The parameters to set, if null then the parameters are defaulted to an empty map

                       String value)

Parameters:

value - the value, never null or empty

removeParameterValue

Remove any value for the given parameter name

Parameters:

setPath

void setPath(String path)
Set a new path, may be null

Parameters:

setReferenceId

void setReferenceId(long referenceId)
Set a reference id

Parameters:

setJobId

void setJobId(long jobId)
Set a new job id

Parameters:

setPublish

void setPublish(boolean pub)
Set the publish state. A state of false means that this assembly item is for an unpublish. See isPublish() for details.

Parameters:
pub - the new state

setVariables

void setVariables(Map<String,String> variables)
Parameters:
variables - The variables to set, see getVariables()

setTemplate

void setTemplate(IPSAssemblyTemplate template)
Parameters:
template - The template to set, see getTemplate()

setUserName

void setUserName(String userName)
Call this to enable using the edit revision if the item is checked out to the user, and otherwise to use the current revision. Note that if this is set, the node returned from getNode() may not match a node set in setNode(Node) as the code in these routines will check the version and replace the node in use if it is not the current or edit reivision.

Parameters:
userName - the user name, may be null but not empty

setFilter

void setFilter(IPSItemFilter filter)
The item filter, see getFilter()

Parameters:
filter - The filter to set.

setDebug

void setDebug(boolean isDebug)
Set if this item is in debug mode. Debug mode means that instead of the assembler set on the template, the debug assembler will be used instead. The debug assembler shows bindings and other information in a friendly fashion for debugging an implementation.

Parameters:
isDebug - true if it is in debug mode

normalize

void normalize()
               throws PSAssemblyException
Handle the dicotomy between the path and sys_contentid, sys_revision and sys_folderid parameters. If the item is created with a path, the three parameters will be filled out (note, no folder id if the item isn't in a folder though). If the item is created with the three parameters, the path will be filled out. In addition the guid of the content item will be calculated and stored.

This method must be called before the item is assembled.

Throws:
PSAssemblyException - if the item is invalid.

clone

Object clone()
Create a clone of the assembly item

Returns:
the clone, never null.

pageClone

IPSAssemblyItem pageClone()
Create a clone for use in pagination. For this purpose, the cloned items must be sanitized to not contain all the information that would normally be present for two reasons:
  • The extra data adds to the cost of serializing and posting the item to the JMS queue
  • Not all the information associated with the work item can be serialized

Returns:
a pagination clone, very similar to a normal clone.

getAssemblyUrl

String getAssemblyUrl()
Get the assembly url.

Returns:
the assembly url, set by the publishing system. May be null for some work items.

getDeliveryContext

int getDeliveryContext()
Get the delivery context ID as an integer.

Returns:
the delivery context, the context used to calculate the delivery location.

setDeliveryPath

void setDeliveryPath(String deliveryPath)
Set the delivery path

Parameters:
deliveryPath - the deliveryPath to set, may be null or empty.

setDeliveryType

void setDeliveryType(String deliveryType)
Set delivery type.

Parameters:
deliveryType - the deliveryType to set, may not be null or empty.

setAssemblyUrl

void setAssemblyUrl(String assemblyUrl)
Set the assembly url.

Parameters:
assemblyUrl - the assembly url, may be null or empty.

setDeliveryContext

void setDeliveryContext(int context)
Set the delivery context

Parameters:
context - the context being used for the delivery location

setUnpublishRefId

void setUnpublishRefId(Long unpubRefId)
Set the reference ID that the unpublishing was originated from.

Parameters:
unpubRefId - the reference ID.

getDeliveryPath

String getDeliveryPath()
Get the delivery path. The delivery path is really only relevant for the file based publisher plug ins.

Returns:
the path, may be null or empty.

getDeliveryType

String getDeliveryType()
Get the delivery type information. A delivery type is the name of a delivery handler. Delivery types are configured through the system's publishing design UI. Each handler can have more than one type associated with it, configuring the handler for a specific use.

The delivery type name is interpreted by the delivery manager to determine what delivery handler Spring bean to use.

Returns:
the delivery type, never null or empty.

getElapsed

int getElapsed()
Get the time that it took for this work item to be assembled. Set by the assembly system. Not valid before assembly.

Returns:
the time in milliseconds.

setStatus

void setStatus(IPSAssemblyResult.Status status)
Sets the status of the result.

Parameters:
status - The status to set.

setElapsed

void setElapsed(int elapsed)
Set the time in milliseconds for the assembly.

Parameters:
elapsed - the time in milliseconds.

setResultData

void setResultData(byte[] resultData)
Store the result data for the assembly. The result data will be stored in a PSPurgableTempFile if it is larger than THRESHOLD bytes in size. Smaller result data is simply stored in memory.

Call either this method or setResultStream(InputStream), but not both. Calling this method will clear any previously stored result data, either in memory or the file system.

Parameters:
resultData - The resultData to set. Once this method has been called the passed array is owned by the work item and should not be further modified. Conversely, there is no guarantee that modifications would be propagated given the possible storage of the data in the file system.

getDeliveryContextId

IPSGuid getDeliveryContextId()
Get the delivery context ID of the item.

Returns:
the GUID of the context ID, never null.

setMimeType

void setMimeType(String mimeType)
Set a new mimetype

Parameters:
mimeType - The mimeType to set, may be null

getNavHelper

com.percussion.services.assembly.impl.nav.PSNavHelper getNavHelper()
The work item holds a navigation helper, which contains information that can be used while assembling any part of an item, either the page, global page or snippets. The reference is cloned to subordinate requests.

Returns:
the nav helper, never null

setResultStream

void setResultStream(InputStream is)
                     throws IOException
Store result data. The result data will be stored in a temporary file in the file system using a PSPurgableTempFile.

Call either this method or setResultData(byte[]), but not both. Calling this method will clear any previously stored result data, either in memory or the file system.

Parameters:
is - the result data stream, may be null. The input stream should be closed by the caller.
Throws:
IOException

getContext

int getContext()
Get the assembly context based on the parameters

Returns:
the context value, or -1 if the parameter cannot be found.

setOriginalTemplateGuid

void setOriginalTemplateGuid(IPSGuid g)
This method is provided so assemblers can help manage the originating template id. Generally, this method does not need to be called, but there are special circumstances where this class cannot properly manage this value. For example, the velocity assembler clones the item before assembling the global template, which would clear this value. However, it should not be cleared in that case. The velocity assembler should call this method after cloning to reset this value to its state before the clone.

removeParameter

void removeParameter(String name)
Remove any value for the given parameter name

Parameters:
name - the parameter name, never null or empty

setPaginated

void setPaginated(boolean value)
Set the paginated state

Parameters:
value - true if paginated.
